pageContext.claim: “You probably saw the numbers today. We are detaining, capturing -- call it anything you want -- more people than ever before.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. For the first six months of the fiscal year, apprehensions on the southern border totaled 361,087. So at that pace, the full year would be about 720,000. Even if the March pace of 104,000 were maintained for the next six months, that would add up to 985,000. Apprehensions were much higher than that for many years before 2006, with the total reaching 1.7 million in fiscal year 2000.
